<math alttext="f of x, equals, 2 raised to the x power, for 0 less than x, less than 1; f of x, equals, one half times x squared, minus x, plus five halves, for 1 less than x, less than 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined above. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is not continuous at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="f of 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is not continuous at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1 from the left, of, f of x, is not equal to, the limit as x approaches 1 from the right, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≠</mo><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>.

<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is not continuous at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.

content.answer: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is not continuous at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="f of 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.
